skillTree.name: Bellower
skillTree.description: A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield and encouraging unbridled carnage.

skillTree.name: Sword Gnoblars
skillTree.description: A small handful of Gnoblars surround this Ogre Lord, their swords always ready to cut and carve.

skillTree.name: Lookout Gnoblars
skillTree.description: Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.

skillTree.name: Lucky Gnoblars
skillTree.description: It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.

skillTree.name: Greased Gnoblars
skillTree.description: Step 1: Grease up your Gnoblars! Step 2: Go faster!

skillTree.name: Sneaky Gnoblars
skillTree.description: You have to watch 'em, as there's no telling what malicious schemes those wickedly cunning Gnoblars might enact.

skillTree.name: Blessed by the Great Maw
skillTree.description: Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.

skillTree.name: Bigga 'n' Stronga
skillTree.description: The largest wealth draws the largest warriors, and few are so wealthy as Greasus Goldtooth.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Campin'
skillTree.description: Wealth, greed and glory are enough to make any basic war camp swell in size.

effects.description:
Camp growth: +5 for all camps
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.name: Betta Campin'
skillTree.description: Running a large camp is one thing. Running an effective camp is another entirely.

skillTree.name: Da Best Campin'
skillTree.description: There are no war camps in all the land to rival those of Greasus Goldtooth.

skillTree.name: Tribestealer
skillTree.description: Once the other tribes laughed when Greasus demanded they pay him tribute. The fools would be laughing on the other side of their faces, if indeed they still had faces…

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Ogre Kingdoms
Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Ogre Kingdoms

skillTree.name: Drakecrush
skillTree.description: What creature can outgrow the shadow cast by Greasus' gargantuan, bulbous form?

skillTree.name: Goldtooth
skillTree.description: Carried by his weary Gnoblar slaves, Greasus is armed and armoured right to the teeth, and is the very picture of domination.

skillTree.name: Overtyrant
skillTree.description: If flesh and conquest are your deepest desire, the Tyrant of all Tyrants is happy to provide.

skillTree.name: Unstoppable Force
skillTree.description: No enemy is immovable when in the path of a furious Ogre's charge.

skillTree.name: Blade Master
skillTree.description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.

skillTree.name: Healthy Appetite
skillTree.description: This Ogre's greed shall never be sated, for his stomach is as endless as his hunger.

skillTree.name: Larger Gutplate
skillTree.description: A truly sturdy armour is needed to hold such an overflowing gut in place.

skillTree.name: Wound-Maker
skillTree.description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Dominance
skillTree.description: If the enormous size of this Ogre doesn't incite terror, his bloody, malevolent smile surely will.

skillTree.name: Scarred Veteran
skillTree.description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

skillTree.name: Hard to Hit
skillTree.description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

skillTree.name: Devastating Charge
skillTree.description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Bull Charge
skillTree.description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Scrappy Fighters
skillTree.description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Beast Riders
skillTree.description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Tools of Destruction
skillTree.description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Best Eaterz
skillTree.description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Beasts of the Mountains
skillTree.description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorn, Gorgers, and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorn, Gorgers, and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Richly Rewarded
skillTree.description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Continuous Volley
skillTree.description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Trained Beasts
skillTree.description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +7 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ravenous Fighters
skillTree.description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

skillTree.name: Hardy
skillTree.description: One can never go hungry on a long march for as long as there are captives for the meat-pot.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Lovely Jubbly
skillTree.description: Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.

skillTree.name: Raider
skillTree.description: Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.

skillTree.name: Ravager
skillTree.description: Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.

skillTree.name: Draftmaster
skillTree.description: Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.

skillTree.name: Looter
skillTree.description: Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

skillTree.name: Brutish Enforcers
skillTree.description: The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.

skillTree.name: Renowned & Feared
skillTree.description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Overtyrant
backgroundSkills.description: "Today the Orcs, tomorrow the world. Let them all tremble!..."

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +50%
	(Lord's army)

items.name: Sceptre of Titans
items.description: This massive sceptre is ensorcelled with spells of might, imbuing Greasus with the strength of a Sky-Titan, as befits his status as the most powerful Ogre alive.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +10% for alliances with Ogre Kingdoms

items.name: Overtyrant's Crown
items.description: This enchanted, basin-sized crown was forged by artisans of the Empire for a king's ransom in gold, and is said to increase Overtyrant's intellect to near-human levels.
